comment: Great professor! Everyone I've talked to also loved him. I took a summer drawing class with him and he was super cool. Laid back, good projects, overall a good class vibe. He could've given better critiques but personally I like a lot of feedback and guidance. I would def take him again!

I'm an Interactive Design student, so this was my first ever class (and real attempt at) drawing. I was quite nervous about it, but Prof. Twiddy was very respectful and taught me a lot throughout the semester, where I can confidently say I have learned to draw. I highly recommend if you want a prof to give you good feedback, while being super chill

One of my favorite professors in the art department. He is kind and understanding. If you're struggling, he's there to help. He never makes us feel like our work isn't good. I failed 2150 twice before I took it with him, it was nice and easy. Just a couple large projects and 2-3 small drawings. He just lets you get in the zone in class. It's nice.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: Simple and very direct class. Very lenient and provides good constructive feedback when necessary. The syllabus is great, where quality is much greatly preferred over quantity. Only wish to know about feedback about the grades on turned-in assignments. Would take him again since he is a chill guy that draws bugs.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Graded by few things

comment: Too lenient, which means any class structure dissolved. How many assignments do we even turn in? How am I doing? You won't know. Dreaded class, hated disappointing him but lack of structure was undoable. We missed out on live models. Hardly ever touches D2L, bad communicator. Ends class unacceptablly early. Great artist though - knows his stuff.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: This prof although he knows what he is doing and gives good feedback, he could improve on accessibility outside of class, send reminder emails earlier instead of around 11pm and midnight, and it would also be helpful to be given feedback for assignments to understand where I am losing points in my grades.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Overall very solid teacher! No complaints, very understanding. He likes to draw bugs, which is very unconventional. Really interesting guy, I would definitely take this class over again!

The projects really build up quick for this class. You get to do a wide range of projects and he was very good at offering advice. You will definitely have to spend a good amount of time on projects at home because he moves on to different projects in the class pretty quickly, but that means you get to dry different things. Great, fun class.

Twiddy was an absolute pleasure to have as a professor. He is very sweet and shy, but that doesn't hinder him from providing valuable feedback and critique when needed. While he is slow to grade projects, he doesn't seem to be harsh or demanding with his criteria. Projects were interesting and fun, and critique days were very nice and comfortable.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: Twiddy is a sweet soul but he is not talkative in the way of critiquing art that you have made. He grades fairly easily based upon if you did the assignment or not! I have only heard good things about him in the other classes he teaches but if you like grades being put in fast and a teacher that gives feedback he may not be your man.

VERY easy class. I never worried about this class or dreaded doing the work bc it was very easy. He is very flexible if there are issues with the online textbook. The whole class is just read the chapter, take the quiz with multiple tries and shows the right answer, then take a test after a bit. Easy disc posts and small paper for the final.

He is an amazing teacher, and I cannot recommend him enough. Cares about your creative freedom and gives very helpful advice. He also gives you plenty of time to work in class and really helped me gain more confidence in my abilities. You will end up doing art in many medias and forms so be prepared to branch out and do something different.

Almost the whole class was based on MindTapAccess. There was maybe 2-3 assignments on D2L. 1 Quiz like once every month, maybe 2. Quizzes were superrrrr easy, I didn't have to read the textbook. The textbook is included on MindTap also. The tests were just like the quizzes as well, and you can check your answers. Best professor ever!!!

Prof. Twiddy isn't a bad professor, but he is very vague when it comes to assignments. He also gives out different sets of instructions to each Drawing 2 class. We were graded on maybe 10-12 assignments for the entire semester. He also sends out emails at 12am-2am about things for the next class period. Be aware of these things when registering.

He's a great professor, no doubt! He is really nice, has interesting discussions with the class, gives good feedback and advice, and lenient. All we had to do is do thumbnails, create the project, write an artist statement, and give feedback to a classmate. The projects were fun to create, I got to experiment with art/mediums I haven't done before.

Professor Twiddy is really awesome, has wealth of knowledge, and gives great feedback on artwork. He's lenient about turning things in. There are in-class and at-home artworks to complete, so just make sure to stay on top of it (because it piles up FAST). When artworks are due, there's an in-class critique. The final is 3 art projects.

Best art professor I've had thus far. Draw three hours & do art critiques, gives good feedback. Due to covid, we had outside drawing assignments and still lives. You work with graphite, charcoal, cante crayon, newsprint, graphite & tracing paper. He let me listen to music while drawing. He's more than happy to help and is quiet and kind!

He is very laid back and sweet. You pretty much have a critique at the beginning of class even if it is just on progress so you always have time to improve the drawing before it is due. He gives you plenty of time to turn in drawings and will help with any questions. His class is very easy as in you just show up and draw for 3 hours then leave.

Enjoyed this class! Grading is all project-based. The Prof really encouraged our creative side and had online meetings specifically to help us with our ideas. His instructions were clear and he's not a harsh grader at all. The discussion boards with the students talking about each of our projects had a very friendly environment the whole semester.

Professor Twiddy has been a godsend during the Covid-19 semester. He is one of the few professors in Kennesaw who actually cares about students. He is always there to respond and he gives good feedback. His projects were fun and creative. Definitely a professor who I will always remember.

He's really nice! I took him for Concepts and Creativity, super fun class, super chill atmosphere, and amazing and really fun projects! He gives great advice and is always willing to help on projects, he's not strict as long as you try but participation really matters!!

Professor Twiddy is the professor to take! He listens to students,letting individual concepts for projects be explored. In class, there is plenty of drawing to be done! There is a strong focus on naturalism, with plenty of still lives. If the weather is nice, the class may take a day to sketch around campus. He's easygoing and genuine too

Professor Twiddy is a new professor so he is still working out some of his projects for the class, but he is super caring and his projects are relevant. He will totally help you as much as he can! Get ready to draw a LOT!
